alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany County in west central Virginia and southeastern Greenbrier Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 730 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roaring Mountain Summit, or just southwest of Alleghany, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... White Sulphur Springs... Neola... Roaring Mountain Summit... Greenbrier State Forest... Alvon... and Callaghan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Additional statements will be issued as conditions warrant.
